remarks: The predicate " ` F ` is a continuous function from topology ` J ` to topology ` K ` at point ` P ` ."  (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2007.)
statement:
iscnp3 $p |- ( ( J e. ( TopOn ` X ) /\ K e. ( TopOn ` Y ) /\ P e. X ) -> ( F e. ( ( J CnP K ) ` P ) <-> ( F : X --> Y /\ A. y e. K ( ( F ` P ) e. y -> E. x e. J ( P e. x /\ x C_ ( `' F " y ) ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
